intro: Hylomecon japonica var. subincisa, commonly known as the Japanese hylomecon, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
